pages.text: Dalmatians only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the B Locus. This gene will determine whether they have black or brown spots.

The B Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'B' and the recessive 'b'. The 'B' allele creates black coloration, while the 'b' allele creates brown or liver coloration. Dogs with one copy of 'b' will carry the brown trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for brown pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'b' will always create either brown carriers or brown puppies.
pages.title: B Locus
